programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 13 Bears (5-0) and Gators (4-1) play the NIT Season Tip-Off final at the Barclays Center. Freshman guard Ja'Kobe Walter's 24 points led Baylor past Oregon State in one semifinal, while Florida iced Pittsburgh 86-71 in the other match.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Heat aim to set up an NBA In-Season Tournament showdown with the Bucks when they face the Knicks. Miami and Milwaukee are 2-0 in East Group A, with their upcoming Nov. 28 clash potentially deciding who advances to the knockout round.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors get a look at Victor Wembanyama as they play his Spurs in the In-Season Tournament. Golden State is 1-1 in West Group C play, while San Antonio is eliminated. Wembanyama is averaging 21.3 points and 10.7 rebounds through three IST games.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers get set for bowl season by visiting the Owls for this regular-season finale. Memphis is heading to the postseason for the ninth time in 10 seasons, and is 2-0 under head coach Ryan Silverfield in bowl games. Temple is 3-3 at home in 2023.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jayden Daniels and the Tigers (8-3, 5-2 SEC) host the Aggies (7-4, 4-3). The programs split the last six meetings with the home team winning each game. Daniels leads the nation with 36 touchdown passes and sits third in passing yards (3,577).

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wildcats try to keep their Pac-12 title hopes alive as they visit the rival Sun Devils. A victory, coupled with an Oregon loss to Oregon State, propels Arizona into an improbable meeting with Washington for conference supremacy on Dec. 2.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Gators host the Seminoles. Florida must win to reach bowl eligibility, but will try to do so without quarterback Graham Mertz, who fractured his collarbone Nov. 18. Playoff-hopeful Florida State lost star QB Jordan Travis the same night.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Bears become bowl-eligible with a victory over the Bruins in a Pac-12 game. UCLA has won three straight meetings. California has won two in a row for the first time this season following a 27-15 triumph over Stanford in the Big Game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Gators host the Seminoles. Florida must win to reach bowl eligibility, but will try to do so without quarterback Graham Mertz, who fractured his collarbone Nov. 18. Playoff-hopeful Florida State lost star QB Jordan Travis the same night.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Yas Marina Circuit in Yas Island, Abu Z ̧aby, United Arab Emirates.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Championship Game.

programme.title: Men's College Wrestling
programme.desc: From Hilton Coliseum in Ames, Iowa.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: The award-winning "E:60" features the best stories in sports. Hosted by Jeremy Schaap and Lisa Salters, this 60-minute ESPN original is a mix of all-access profiles with the biggest names, the most compelling stories from off the field of play, in-depth investigative reports and lighthearted tales, all presented with a cinematic sensibility.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Compelling stories centered around sports and athletes, ranging from dramatic to comedic.

programme.title: Don't Ever Give Up
programme.desc: Jim Valvano spoke iconic and inspirational words at the 1993 ESPYs, shortly before he passed from cancer; this special features Valvano's full speech, as well as other inspirational ESPY speeches since that time.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Bears become bowl-eligible with a victory over the Bruins in a Pac-12 game. UCLA has won three straight meetings. California has won two in a row for the first time this season following a 27-15 triumph over Stanford in the Big Game.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Monday Blitz
programme.desc: A fast-paced offering that blends the NFL and college football while focusing on the weekend that was and broader topics; includes moments and significant achievements from all levels of football, such as high school, youth and flag football.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cyclones try to stay unbeaten as they face the Hokies in the ESPN Events Invitational semifinals. Keshon Gilbert and Tamin Lipsey scored 22 points apiece in Iowa State's 68-64 win over VCU in the semifinals. Virginia Tech took out Boise State.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Consolation Game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Championship Game.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: John T. Edge travels around the region, introducing viewers to Southern tastemakers, food, culture and history as they intertwine in the beautiful yet complex South.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: A look at the moments that drove sports bettors wild during recent games.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Heat aim to set up an NBA In-Season Tournament showdown with the Bucks when they face the Knicks. Miami and Milwaukee are 2-0 in East Group A, with their upcoming Nov. 28 clash potentially deciding who advances to the knockout round.

programme.title: UFC Greatest Fights
programme.desc: A look at the middleweight main event bout between Anderson Silva and Michael Bisping at UFC Fight Night in London.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Witness the rise of "Sugar" Sean O'Malley to superstardom with a collection of his biggest wins to date.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: Memorable knock-outs from throughout MMA history.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Mustangs (9-2, 7-0 American) try to cap off a perfect league schedule as they host the Midshipmen (5-5, 4-3). Navy can clinch bowl eligibility with an upset victory, but will get another opportunity in the traditional game against Army on Dec. 9.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Dukes visit the Chanticleers. On Nov. 18, James Madison's perfect season ended as it lost a crucial contest in overtime to Appalachian State. The Dukes are ineligible for postseason play, including the Sun Belt title game, due to an NCAA ruling.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Jayhawks and Bearcats close out the regular season. Kansas running back Devin Neal reached career rushing totals of 2,900 yards and 30 TDs, and topped 1,000 yards rushing for the second straight year, during a Sunflower Showdown loss Nov. 18.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: 2023 AKC Canine Flyball CanAm Classic
programme.desc: AKC's Fastest Dogs USA features top ranked canine competitors among the country's fastest breeds to determine who really is the fastest dog in the country. From Rock Hill, S.C.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: A boxing gym on the Blackfeet Indian Reservation in Montana teaches young girls how to defend themselves in response to the crisis of missing and murdered Indigenous women. A film about fighting for respect, identity and survival.

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: Documentary about the career and legacy of Louis Sockalexis, the first Native American to play major league baseball.

programme.title: Fantasy Focus
programme.desc: Field Yates hosts ESPN's top Fantasy Football experts for a daily discussion of rankings, injuries and game previews and debate how the biggest NFL stories impact Fantasy Football.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Falcons (8-3, 5-2) and Broncos (6-5, 5-2) play for a spot in the Mountain West title game. Air Force has dropped three in a row after racing to its best start since 1985. Boise State has topped 40 points both times during a two-game win streak.

programme.title: BMW Ultimate Update
programme.desc: Scores, news and highlights from today's college football action.

programme.title: WWE Friday Night SmackDown
programme.desc: On the eve of Survivor Series: WarGames, The Street Profits challenge The Judgment Day for the Undisputed WWE Tag Team Championship.

programme.title: WWE Friday Night SmackDown
programme.desc: On the eve of Survivor Series: WarGames, The Street Profits challenge The Judgment Day for the Undisputed WWE Tag Team Championship.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: Motorcycle Racing
programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: All Madden
programme.desc: A tribute to John Madden's groundbreaking career - centered largely on the time after his Hall of Fame coaching career ended.

programme.title: 2023 FIFA U-17 World Cup
programme.desc: From Manahan Stadium, in Surakarta, Jawa Tengah, Indonesia.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawkeyes (3-2) match up with the Pirates (4-1) in the Rady Children's Invitational consolation final. Seton Hall failed to extend its perfect start in the semifinals, falling 71-63 against No. 23 USC. Iowa fell short against Oklahoma.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: Top college football games from the Big 12, Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences, beginning each Saturday with the brand-new Big Noon Kickoff pregame show on Fox.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Knights host the Cougars in this regular-season finale for both squads. Houston quarterback Donovan Smith has accounted for 27 of the Cougars' 36 scores this season. UCF's RJ Harvey has eight TDs across his past three games, and 16 total in 2023.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Another Border Battle pits the Golden Gophers (5-6, 3-5 Big Ten) against the Badgers (6-5, 4-4). Minnesota tries to secure bowl eligibility for 2023 by winning a third straight over Wisconsin. However, the Gophers have dropped three in a row overall.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bears try to finish strong as they host the Mountaineers. The schools have alternated wins across the past five meetings, with the home team prevailing in each. West Virginia sophomore CJ Donaldson Jr. has rushed for a TD in nine straight games.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bulldogs (8-3, 4-3 MWC) prepare for bowl season by visiting the Aztecs (3-8, 1-6). Fresno State has dropped two in a row to fall out of contention for the Mountain West title despite starting 8-1 and beating UNLV, the top seed entering Week 13.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wolverines and Buckeyes square off as 11-0 teams for the second straight season. A Big Ten championship game berth and an all-but-certain spot in the College Football Playoff await the winner. Michigan won the last two meetings.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the 2023 season with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the 2023 season with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Washington and Washington State play for the final Apple Cup as members of the Pac-12. The undefeated Huskies, who have already clinched a spot in the Pac-12 title game, lead the series 75-33-6. Washington moves to the Big Ten next season.

programme.desc: The Climbing Post keeps the sport's fans abreast of the latest news and highlights.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: The Dynamo seek their first trip to the MLS Cup Conference Final since 2017 as they play Sporting KC. Houston defeated Real Salt Lake to earn a date with SKC, who want their first final berth since 2018 after eliminating top-seeded St. Louis City SC.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Cintas Center in Cincinnati.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Friars (4-1) begin a three-game homestand by facing the Mountain Hawks (1-4). Providence salvaged its Bahamas Championship outing with a 71-64 win over Georgia on Nov. 19. Devin Carter has led the Friars in scoring in three straight contests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies link up with the Jaspers. UConn won the Empire Classic 81-71 over No. 15 Texas on Nov. 20, moving its double-digit win streak versus non-conference opponents to 22. North Carolina holds the record with 23 such victories (2008-2009).

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Sooners (5-0) and No. 23 Trojans (4-1) compete for the inaugural Rady Children's Invitational title. Senior guard Boogie Ellis continued his hot start with 22 points in USC's semifinal win over Seton Hall. Oklahoma breezed past Iowa 79-67.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawkeyes (3-2) match up with the Pirates (4-1) in the Rady Children's Invitational consolation final. Seton Hall failed to extend its perfect start in the semifinals, falling 71-63 against No. 23 USC. Iowa fell short against Oklahoma.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Heisman Trophy candidate Bo Nix and the No. 6 Ducks clinch a berth in the Pac-12 title game with a victory over the rival No. 16 Beavers. Oregon State has won two of the last three meetings. Nix boasts 35 touchdown passes against two interceptions.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Tigers (1-5) aim to keep the momentum rolling when they visit the Hoyas (3-2) in the nation's capital. Jackson State picked up its first win by upsetting Missouri 73-72 on Nov. 19. Chase Adams (JKST) hit the go-ahead shot with five seconds left.

programme.title: 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: Day 2 of the 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show; the winning dogs across the seven AKC-recognized groups compete for the ultimate prize at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Joel Soriano and the Red Storm (3-2) welcome the Crusaders (2-4) to Carnesecca Arena. Soriano, a 6-foot-11 senior center, averages 16.2 points, 11.2 rebounds and 2.2 blocks per game. Holy Cross senior guard Joe Octave scores 16.3 points per contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Huskies (4-1) make the short trip to play their in-state rivals, the Blue Demons (1-4), in Chicago. Northern Illinois seeks its first win over DePaul since 2005. The Blue Demons have won all four meetings since, most recently in 2014.
